doc.after: The F-35's sensor and communications suite has situational awareness, command and control and network-centric warfare capabilities.[208][316] The main sensor on board is the AN/APG-81 Active electronically scanned array-radar, designed by Northrop Grumman Electronic Systems.[317] It is augmented by the nose-mounted Electro-Optical Targeting System (EOTS),[318] it provides the capabilities of an externally mounted Sniper Advanced Targeting Pod pod with a reduced radar cross-section.[319][320] The AN/ASQ-239 (Barracuda) system is an improved version of the F-22's AN/ALR-94 electronic warfare suite, providing sensor fusion of Radio frequency and Infrared tracking functions, advanced radar warning receiver including geolocation targeting of threats, multispectral image countermeasures for self-defense against missiles, situational awareness and electronic surveillance, employing 10 radio frequency antennae embedded into the edges of the wing and tail.[321][322]
